text: today I'm gonna show you how to sharpen
an all-purpose chef's knife before you
sharpen your knives you want to soak the
stone in water for about anywhere
between five to ten minutes you want the
bubbles and the air out of the stone you
want it lubricated with as much water as
possible so when the bubbles stop coming
out from inside the stone you know
you're ready to use it and now you want
to take your knife here and you want to
put it flat against the stone and you're
going to lift the back end of the knife
up about 15 degrees and that is about
maybe the thickness of a matchbook I
would say and start at the tip 15
degrees slide on the stone make sure
it's well lubricated and you're gonna
come all the way across the stone and
you want to do this maybe about five six
even seven times and now I'm gonna
switch to the other side you can add a
little bit more water if your stone gets
too dry and again you're gonna repeat
the same process where you're dragging
the blade on that 15 degree angle from
the butt end all the way to the tip and
I'm going to flip the stone and I'm
going to use the finer side of the stone
to really refine the blade that we're
creating so you're going from a coarse
level now to a finer level so again it's
the same process and there you go you
should have a pretty sharp knife enjoy
guys
